titleStmt.title: Charles Gahres and Martha J. Gahres v. Isabella Sutton and W. H. Barrett. Plaintiffs Answer

publicationStmt.authority: Bring Me the Body: A Digital & Print History of Marginalized Habeas Corpus Petitioners in the North American West, 1804-1912

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Charles Gahres and Martha J. Gahres v. Isabella Sutton and W. H. Barrett. Plaintiffs Answer
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1889

div1.p:
Plffs for answer to Deft return herein to writ of Habeas Corpus a complaint herein Denies what the mother of said child Martha J Cravens (now Martha J Gahres) had no home and no means of procuring one denies that she did not possess the ability to take care of & provide said child child and provide for it Denies that she expressed great hate or any hate for said childs father or that she was desirous of removing the said child from her gaze Denies that she expressed any hate whatever for said child, denies that she brought Defts to take charge of and rear said child denies that she promised and agreed to leave said child with of Deft for any greater length of time than until she should desire a return
thereof denies that the departure manifested by Plff Martha J Ghares render her an incompetent person to take care of and rear said child or to have the control thereof. Deny that Deffs are proper persons to have the care control and custody of said child and avers that Dffs are not married but are living together as man and wife in laws of the country and that the Evil examples thereof will be detrimental to the morals of said child and alleges that Plffs being lawfully married and having ample means are competent to rear and educate said child denies that no demand has been made for said child and avers that sometime during the month of October 1870 Plff Martha J Gahres did demand the return of said child from deft Isabella Sutton
and that said Isabella Sutton did refuse to return the same wherefore plffs pray judgement as the original complaint
